column4: can anyone recommend a usb-sound card that plays nicely with ubuntu?
most of them should.
(they all use the same driver)
how can they all use the same driver> thats very odd, because that implies they all use the same chipsets?
it's the usb audio standard.
granted many manufacturers don't adhere to the spec, so we have to hardcode quirks into the driver...
well, that may be overkill. Which driver are you currently using?
Card: HDA Intel   Chip: SigmaTel STAC9200
ah, yeah, the infamous 92xx.
are you using 2.6.15-26.45?
dpkg -l linux-image-$(uname -r) |grep ^ii |awk '{ print $2 }'

err, sorry, that should be 3, not 2
no, uname is insufficient, since I need the actual packaging revision, which uname doesn't reveal.

ok, try changing the parameter for 'Capture Mux'
it's currently set to 4, so you'll want to try the values 0, 1, 2, and 3.
how do I change mate?
amixer set 'Capture Mux' 0
then test if you can hear what you record. If it doesn't work, repeat for the values of 1-3.
no joy
managed to get some static with options 2-4 but thats all
ok. Well, I use an M-Audio Transit USB, but just about any USB audio device should work.
